pcd.data

Class ImageDataStorage

  • java.lang.Object
    • pcd.data.ImageDataStorage

  • public class ImageDataStorage
extends Object
    Author:
    Tibor Sloboda Holds and manipulates ImageDataObject, as well as utilizing and creating new windows with the PythonProcess linked inside them to retrieve new data from Python to update the ImageDataObject

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ImageDataStorage(ArrayList<String> typeConfigList, ArrayList<Integer> typeIdentifierList, ArrayList<String> typeIconList, ArrayList<String> typeTypeList)
      Initializes the ImageDataStorage with configuration fields and gets an instance for the PythonProcess and ImageDataObjectFactory

    • Constructor Detail

      • ImageDataStorage

        public ImageDataStorage(ArrayList<String> typeConfigList,
                        ArrayList<Integer> typeIdentifierList,
                        ArrayList<String> typeIconList,
                        ArrayList<String> typeTypeList)
        Initializes the ImageDataStorage with configuration fields and gets an instance for the PythonProcess and ImageDataObjectFactory
        Parameters:
        typeConfigList - A list of cilia type name identifiers
        typeIdentifierList - A list of cilia type numeric IDs
        typeIconList - A optional (can be empty) list of icons to replace colors for point markers
        typeTypeList - A list of the kind of types a cilia is (healthy/unhealthy)

    • Method Detail

      • getTypeConfigList

        public ArrayList<String> getTypeConfigList()
        Returns:
        returns the typeConfigList

        public ArrayList<Integer> getTypeIdentifierList()
        Returns:

      • stopProcess

        public void stopProcess()
        Stops the python process

      • addImage

        public void addImage(String path)
        Adds a new image object to imageList based on image path.
        Parameters:
        path - a String path to the image. Should be absolute.

      • getBufferedImage

        public BufferedImage getBufferedImage(int index)
        Retrieves the BufferedImage of the image associated with ImageDataObject. It also updates the current image object based on the supplied index. If the path to the image isn't valid, it will offer to navigate to a new image file. This also updates the associated image file inside ImageDataObject
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the ImageDataObject in imageList
        Returns:
        a BufferedImage of the associated image, or null if invalid file
        See Also:
        ImageDataObject

      • getBufferedImage

        public BufferedImage getBufferedImage()
        Load the image of the currently active ImageDataObject
        Returns:
        a BufferedImage of the associated image to current, or null if invalid file

      • getAndUpdateCurrentImage

        public ImageDataObject getAndUpdateCurrentImage(int index)
        Retrieves an ImageDataObject based on index from imageList and updates current to it.
        Parameters:
        index - index of the image object to retrieve
        Returns:
        the retrieved ImageDataObject

      • getImage

        public ImageDataObject getImage(int index)
        Retrieves an ImageDataObject based on index from imageList.
        Parameters:
        index - index of the image object to retrieve
        Returns:
        the retrieved ImageDataObject

      • getCurrent

        public ImageDataObject getCurrent()
        Retrieves the currently active ImageDataObject.
        Returns:
        the retrieved current or null if never assigned

        public Overlay getOverlay()

        Returns:

        public boolean checkOpened(File f)
        Uses a stream to find whether passed file matches any image path of ImageDataObject.
        Parameters:
        f - the file to be checked
        Returns:
        true if a match is found

      • setFrame

        public void setFrame(MainFrame aThis)
        Sets the parent GUI frame, specifically an instance of MainFrame
        Parameters:
        aThis - the parent frame

      • addPoint

        public void addPoint(PcdPoint pcdPoint,
                     String newClickType)
        Complementary to addPoint(pcd.data.PcdPoint) for when we don't know the point's type ID, just the name of the type. It adds a new point after determining the ID of the type name, and sets the name to the point.
        Parameters:
        pcdPoint - the point to be added
        newClickType - the String containing the name of the cilia type

      • getColor

        public PcdColor getColor(PcdPoint p)
        Retrieves a PcdColor based on the point
        Parameters:
        p - the PcdPoint for which to retrieve the color
        Returns:
        the associated color

      • getColor

        public PcdColor getColor(String typeName)
        Retrieves a PcdColor based on the cilia type specified in configuration
        Parameters:
        typeName - the String matching one of the type names in configuration
        Returns:
        the associated color

      • getIcon

        public BufferedImage getIcon(PcdPoint point)
        Deprecated. 
        Gets an icon based on the path of the associated point type from the icon list
        Parameters:
        point - the point for which to retrieve an icon
        Returns:
        the loaded BufferedImage

      • getIcon

        public BufferedImage getIcon(String identifier)
        Deprecated. 
        Gets an icon based on the path of the identifier of a cilia type
        Parameters:
        identifier - the type ID for which to get an icon
        Returns:
        the loaded BufferedImage

      • getPointTypeName

        public String getPointTypeName(PcdPoint p)
        Gets the name of the type in the passed point based on its associated ID from the config.
        Parameters:
        p - the point for which to get the type name of
        Returns:
        the associated name of the type

      • getPointIdentifier

        public int getPointIdentifier(String s)
        Retrieves the ID of a type name.
        Parameters:
        s - the name of the type
        Returns:
        the type ID

      • getCounts

        public ArrayList<AtomicInteger> getCounts()
        Counts the total amounts of each cilia type by occurrence.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList containing AtomicInteger ordered the same as typeConfigList containing the number of points that have this identifier, each.

      • getCounts

        public ArrayList<AtomicInteger> getCounts(ImageDataObject imgObj)
        The same as getCounts() but for a specific ImageDataObject
        Parameters:
        imgObj - the image object for which to retrieve counts
        Returns:
        same as getCounts()

      • getPcdRate

        public String getPcdRate(ArrayList<AtomicInteger> counts)
        Calculates the primary defect rate. It is important this is calculated correctly for diagnosis, and it must retrieve the same value regardless of platform, therefore it has the strictfp modifier to calculate these values precisely and in the same manner on all platforms.
        Parameters:
        counts - an ArrayList of AtomicInteger matching the typeConfigList indexing order
        Returns:
        a formatted string, rounding the resulting value to 2 decimal places for displaying in the GUI

      • getSecRate

        public String getSecRate(ArrayList<AtomicInteger> counts)
        Calculates the secondary defect rate. It is identical to getPcdRate(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicInteger>) but for secondary defects.
        Parameters:
        counts - an ArrayList of AtomicInteger matching the typeConfigList indexing order
        Returns:
        a formatted string, rounding the resulting value to 2 decimal places for displaying in the GUI

      • isInitialized

        public boolean isInitialized()
        Checks whether the active (current) image object is point initialized.
        Returns:
        true if initialized, and false if current image is null or not initialized

      • isAngleInitialized

        public boolean isAngleInitialized()
        Checks whether the active (current) image object is angle initialized.
        Returns:
        true if initialized, and false if current image is null or not initialized

      • addPoint

        public void addPoint(PcdPoint pcdPoint)
        Adds a new point to the current active ImageDataObject
        Parameters:
        pcdPoint - the PcdPoint to be added
        See Also:
        ImageDataObject.addPoint(pcd.data.PcdPoint)

      • remPoint

        public void remPoint(PcdPoint pcdPoint)
        Removes a point form the current active ImageDataObject
        Parameters:
        pcdPoint - the PcdPoint to be removed
        See Also:
        ImageDataObject.remPoint(pcd.data.PcdPoint)

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Removes the currently image object from imageList and sets current to null.

      • getImageObjectList

        public final List<ImageDataObject> getImageObjectList()
        Returns the reference to the whole list of ImageDataObject. It breaks encapsulation but is safe. Data is saved continuously so it can be easily restored, and protections are in place to prevent overflow exploits and stalling of the application.
        Returns:
        a List of ImageDataObject
        See Also:
        ImageDataObject.addPoint(pcd.data.PcdPoint), ImageDataObject.getPointList(), ImageDataObject.setPointList(java.util.ArrayList)

      • getImageNames

        public ArrayList<String> getImageNames()
        Gets all the image names of currently saved ImageDataObject
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of associated image names

      • setImageObjectList

        public void setImageObjectList(ArrayList<ImageDataObject> list)
        Replaces the imageList with a new one. This is for the purpose of loading a project file. The safety is checked to prevent overflow by checking the point amount in each image object.
        Parameters:
        list - the ImageDataObject ArrayList to replace the current one

      • isInitialized

        public boolean isInitialized(int index)
        Check whether a specific ImageDataObject is initialized.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the image to check
        Returns:
        true if initialized, or false if index exceeds maximum or not initialized

      • initializeAngles

        public boolean initializeAngles()
        Used to display a loading window and initialize retrieval of angles using Python. It also calculates the average from the positive normalized angles, and the number of them, before passing it to ImageDataObject for calculation of standard deviation and saving.
        Returns:
        true if method succeeded or already initialized, or false it something went wrong or not point initialized

      • inferImage

        public boolean inferImage()
        Used to display a loading window and initialize retrieval of points using Python. It retrieves the points from Python before passing them to ImageDataObject for initialization and saving.
        Returns:
        true if method succeeded or already initialized, or false it something went wrong

      • initImage

        public boolean initImage(int i,
                         ArrayList<PcdPoint> pointlist)
        Initializes a specific index of ImageDataObject in imageList with passed points.
        Parameters:
        i - index to initialize
        pointlist - the list of PcdPoint to initialize it with
        Returns:
        true if the image is initialized

      • inferImages

        public void inferImages(ArrayList<Integer> idxList)
        Submit image object indexes for inference by Python.
        Parameters:
        idxList - the indexes of objects in imageList

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears the imageList. This does not update cache, so any malicious intent can be easily reversed with the press of a single button.
        See Also:
        MainFrame.restoreItemActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent)

      • setPointType

        public void setPointType(PcdPoint p,
                         String string)
        Sets a point to a new type based on type name.
        Parameters:
        p - the to be modified
        string - the type name as found in typeConfigList

      • loadProject

        public void loadProject(File file)
        Load the image object list from a project file. Safe-proofed against malicious intent.
        Parameters:
        file - the project file to load
        See Also:
        FileUtils.loadProject(java.io.File), setImageObjectList(java.util.ArrayList)
